commit.message:
Portage.Host: Use `warn` for config warning

Use the `warn` function from the `Util` module for the hackport config
warning.

Have hackportConfig return the full path to the `repositories` config
file.

Use MaybeT in places to improve code simplicity.

commit.message:
Merge: Remove exitSuccess from diffEbuilds

The diffEbuilds function calls exitSuccess which terminates the program
and prevents any more output from being displayed. This seems like a
mistake, and in any event it prevents warnings from being displayed at
the end of the output.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 372d0a91b515ab3a3aeaf58c7f451f1b0d300f4c
parent 29349969f046a6b2247f136a474dc9ab99bbbb4d
author hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1711226553 -0600
committer hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1711227807 -0600

Merge: Remove exitSuccess from diffEbuilds

The diffEbuilds function calls exitSuccess which terminates the program
and prevents any more output from being displayed. This seems like a
mistake, and in any event it prevents warnings from being displayed at
the end of the output.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

commit.message:
Display summary of warnings at end of execution

Hackport is noisy. At the end of the output, display any warnings that
were fired so that they are easier to notice. We use a DList to hold
the list of warnings. This adds `StateT WarningBuffer` to the Env monad
stack and runs displayWarnings (new function) as the last part of
runEnv.

Add `warn` function to the Util module and display warnings whenever
`die` is called.

Convert `errorWarnOnUnbuildable` in the Merge module to use the new
warning functionality.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 91021e82172877b0abfed7baeeb7ca5f16f2ae04
parent 19f61bef53cde37193a078fc8ab9da0e20101b41
author hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1711218760 -0600
committer hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1711227664 -0600

Display summary of warnings at end of execution

Hackport is noisy. At the end of the output, display any warnings that
were fired so that they are easier to notice. We use a DList to hold
the list of warnings. This adds `StateT WarningBuffer` to the Env monad
stack and runs displayWarnings (new function) as the last part of
runEnv.

Add `warn` function to the Util module and display warnings whenever
`die` is called.

Convert `errorWarnOnUnbuildable` in the Merge module to use the new
warning functionality.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

commit.message:
Portage.Tables: Simplify module

Two packages were handled specially by hackport since they had non-0
slots. Now that those packages have been switched to a 0 slot, the
code to specially handle them is no longer needed.

In the future, there shouldn't be any other packages with non-0 slots,
so the code in Portage.Tables should be removed.

This is a correction of the mistake that was made in
bb0f72ded553b0fe79f8b7ac1678e100900869f8.

Bug: https://github.com/gentoo-haskell/gentoo-haskell/issues/1502
Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree efbd0396e1aa754b88e0e2b054753d2e18c3378a
parent 1f30e2c37919dc83b3a3bff16e470820f08c4e8d
author hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1707975067 -0700
committer hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1707977893 -0700

Portage.Tables: Simplify module

Two packages were handled specially by hackport since they had non-0
slots. Now that those packages have been switched to a 0 slot, the
code to specially handle them is no longer needed.

In the future, there shouldn't be any other packages with non-0 slots,
so the code in Portage.Tables should be removed.

This is a correction of the mistake that was made in
bb0f72ded553b0fe79f8b7ac1678e100900869f8.

Bug: https://github.com/gentoo-haskell/gentoo-haskell/issues/1502
Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

commit.message:
Revert "Remove Portage.Tables module"

Part of the code is what adds the := operator to dependencies, so it
needs to be fixed but not removed entirely.

This reverts commit bb0f72ded553b0fe79f8b7ac1678e100900869f8.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

commit.message:
Portage.Metadata.RemoteId: Trim unneeded sources

Some of the remote-id sources are specifically for other languages and
have a 0% chance of ever hosting Haskell source code. These have been
removed:

- cpan
- cran
- ctan
- pecl
- pypi
- rubygems
- vim

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

tree 42fee3ae429e197ce438f9edf30768db14c8c2cc

commit.message:
Portage.Metadata: Fix remote-id from homepage

Instead of falling back on remote-id from homepage only if there are no
other remote-ids, try to merge it into the list unconditionally.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

commit.message:
Portage.GHCCore: simplify core library lists

The following packages share the same version as GHC and can be
automatically inferred from the GHC version: ghc-boot, ghc-boot-th,
ghc-heap, and ghci.

Add a GHC version parameter to mkIndex to create these entries
automatically and a mkInfoIndex helper function.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 53c35d579f577f1d418624da7ac7455b75623867
parent e47bc03581a51188b7deb66426a6f365fe17cb92
author hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1706909786 -0700
committer hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1707043321 -0700

Portage.GHCCore: simplify core library lists

The following packages share the same version as GHC and can be
automatically inferred from the GHC version: ghc-boot, ghc-boot-th,
ghc-heap, and ghci.

Add a GHC version parameter to mkIndex to create these entries
automatically and a mkInfoIndex helper function.

commit.message:
Update hackage-security

Switch to latest commit from upstream hackage-security repo. The
gentoo-haskell fork of hackage-security seems to be redundant as it does
not contain any commits that deviate from upstream.

Update hackport.cabal to contain updated information copied from
hackage-security.cabal. Reorder some elements to match the ordering in
the upstream .cabal file.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 17ef097946b9de5daf4f892b4719634f91f2efe3
parent ae73b286e88ec7ac564b3a9581948fd536882b4b
author hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1705373133 -0700
committer hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com> 1705373284 -0700

Update hackage-security

Switch to latest commit from upstream hackage-security repo. The
gentoo-haskell fork of hackage-security seems to be redundant as it does
not contain any commits that deviate from upstream.

Update hackport.cabal to contain updated information copied from
hackage-security.cabal. Reorder some elements to match the ordering in
the upstream .cabal file.

Signed-off-by: hololeap <hololeap@protonmail.com>
